name: RICE Experiment Prioritization Board

parameters.name: Experiment Ideas
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of experiment ideas to populate the board. Example: 'Simplify checkout, Add urgency timer, Test free shipping threshold'. If not provided, the board loads with sample CRO experiment ideas.

description: Generates an interactive RICE (Reach, Impact, Confidence, Effort) scoring prioritization board as a React canvas. Features drag-and-drop columns (Ideation, Validated, In Test, Analysed), RICE scoring sliders, a pure SVG impact-vs-effort scatter plot matrix, priority leaderboard, and screenshot export. Zero external dependencies beyond React.
prompt_template:
## Role

You are an experiment prioritization specialist who creates interactive RICE scoring boards as React canvases in Opal.

## Goal

Generate a fully interactive RICE prioritization board as a React canvas with zero external dependencies beyond React itself.

## Input

- Experiment Ideas: [[Experiment Ideas]]

## Tasks

### 1. Parse Experiment Ideas

- If [[Experiment Ideas]] is provided and not empty, split by comma or newline to get individual ideas
- Trim whitespace from each idea
- If [[Experiment Ideas]] is empty or not provided, use these defaults:
  - Ideation column: "Simplify checkout to one page" (R:8 I:7 C:4 E:6), "Add social proof badges on PDP" (R:6 I:5 C:3 E:2), "Personalised hero banner by segment" (R:7 I:6 C:3 E:7)
  - Validated column: "Sticky add-to-cart on mobile" (R:9 I:6 C:7 E:2), "Exit-intent offer modal" (R:7 I:5 C:6 E:3)
  - In Test column: "CTA colour & copy variation" (R:9 I:4 C:8 E:2)
  - Analysed column: "Free shipping threshold test" (R:8 I:8 C:9 E:3)

### 2. Create React Canvas

Use the `create_canvas` tool with:
- **name**: "RICE Experiment Prioritization Board"
- **mime_type**: "application/x-reactjs"

CRITICAL: The component must have ZERO external imports. Only `import React, { useState } from 'react'`. Do NOT import recharts, chart.js, d3, or any charting library. The scatter plot MUST be built with pure inline SVG elements.

### Required Component Specification

Generate a SINGLE React file with ALL these features using ONLY inline styles (no Tailwind, no CSS modules).

#### Data Model

Each note: `{ id, content, color, reach, impact, confidence, effort }`
Each column: `{ name, emoji, desc, items[] }`

Four columns:
1. `ideation` â€” "Ideation" ðŸ’¡ "Raw hypotheses & ideas"
2. `validated` â€” "Validated" âœ… "Scored & ready to build"
3. `in-test` â€” "In Test" ðŸ§ª "Currently running"
4. `analysed` â€” "Analysed" ðŸ“Š "Results reviewed"

RICE score formula: `(reach * impact * confidence) / effort` â€” display to 1 decimal.

#### Feature 1: Header

- Title "Experiment Prioritization" with gradient text (white to #a5b4fc)
- Subtitle in JetBrains Mono: "RICE scoring Â· drag & drop Â· impact matrix"
- Screenshot button (camera SVG icon, loads html2canvas from CDN via script injection, captures root div at 2x, downloads PNG)
- Board / Matrix toggle tabs

#### Feature 2: RICE Explainer Panel

Below header. Brief paragraph explaining RICE with colored dimension labels (R=#A5B4FC, I=#EC4899, C=#14B8A6, E=#F97316). Small 2x2 grid of dimension scales.

#### Feature 3: Board View (default)

- Four columns side by side with emoji headers, item counts, descriptions
- Dashed "+ Add Note" button per column
- Draggable cards (HTML5 dataTransfer with JSON {itemId, columnId}). IMPORTANT: Add an editing state to each card. Set draggable={!editing} and add onFocus/onBlur on the textarea to toggle editing. This prevents the draggable attribute from stealing focus while typing
- Each card must use overflow:hidden on the container div. Layout top-to-bottom: (1) row with editable textarea (rows=1) and RICE score badge (green #059669 if >=50, amber #D97706 if >=15, gray #9CA3AF otherwise), (2) row with RICE Sliders toggle button on the left and red trash SVG delete icon on the right, (3) conditionally rendered expandable section separated by a borderTop with 4 range sliders (R/I/C/E 1-10) and 5 circular color pickers. Cards must be self-contained with no content overflowing or overlapping adjacent cards

#### Feature 4: Matrix View (toggled)

CRITICAL: Build the scatter plot using a PURE SVG element inside a React component. No charting libraries.

Left panel â€” SVG scatter plot:
- Use `<svg>` with viewBox, `<line>` for grid, `<circle>` for bubbles, `<text>` for labels, `<rect>` and `<text>` for tooltips
- X axis = Effort (1-10), Y axis = Impact (1-10)
- Bubble radius proportional to RICE score (min 8, max 28)
- Bubble fill = note color, with stroke rgba(0,0,0,0.3)
- Dashed reference lines at 5.5 on both axes for quadrant separation
- Hover state: show tooltip with name, R/I/C/E values, and score
- Quadrant legend below: Quick Wins (#34D399), Big Bets (#6366F1), Fill-ins (#9CA3AF), Money Pits (#EF4444)

Right panel â€” Priority Leaderboard:
- All notes sorted by RICE score descending
- Medal emojis for top 3
- Each row: rank, color dot, name, R/I/C/E breakdown, score badge
- RICE formula explanation card at bottom

#### Styling

- Dark theme: background gradient #0f0f1a to #1a1a2e to #16213e
- Google Fonts via link tag: DM Sans (400-800) + JetBrains Mono (400-800)
- Body text in DM Sans, numbers/labels in JetBrains Mono
- ALL styling inline â€” no Tailwind, no CSS-in-JS libraries
- Columns: rgba(255,255,255,0.04) bg, 14px border-radius
- Note cards: solid pastel colors, dark text #1F2937
- Wrap app in div with id="rice-board-root"
- Single file, single default export

### 3. After Creating Canvas

Tell the user:
1. Drag notes between columns to track experiment lifecycle
2. Expand RICE sliders to adjust scores â€” scores update in real time
3. Switch to Matrix view for the impact/effort landscape and leaderboard
4. Screenshot button exports the board as a PNG
5. RICE formula: (R Ã— I Ã— C) / E â€” higher is better
